Posts.Content: Jan 30, 2019 09:17PM HD9700 wrote: This could be it! Maybe change the topic? Wow you’ve already been through a lot. How are you holding up? I’m finally scheduled for surgery on 2/4. I’m trying to keep the worry down with mindfulness training. I have my second class the night after surgery. Hope to hear from other February surgery pals soon.
Posts.Title: Is there a February 2019 Surgery Thread yet? BWH5 SwedeSue

Posts.Content: Mar 14, 2019 12:40PM HD9700 wrote: Hello everyone...I'll be joining you this month, AC x 4, T x 4 starting 3/20 if I can get my port inserted before then. Otherwise I'll start the next Wednesday, 3/27. My echo is scheduled for 3/19. I have my first PT consultation for cording on 3/18. I'm hoping to get some relief before the chemo SEs begin. I came home and scheduled a hair appointment for today. I'm hoping I don't lose it in the stylist's chair. Reminder to self: bring a box of tissues. I have a couple hours to scour Pinterest for pixie cut ideas. I was planning on a shorter cut before I found out that chemo was a certainty anyway. So glad I have this forum. Even if I don’t post much, I’m always lurking and cheering everyone on. ~Lis
Posts.Title: Chemo starting March 2019 Fallschurchgirl Laurencl
